definition: Apophasis on Wikipedia
A [population bottleneck](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Population_bottleneck
) is a sharp reduction in the size of a population due to extraordinary events which can reduce the variation in its gene pool.
Contrapasso refers to the punishment of souls in Dante's Inferno, by a process either resembling or contrasting with the sin itself.
Dunbar's number is a suggested cognitive limit to the number of people with whom one can maintain stable social relationships.
The Dilbert principle refers states that companies tend to systematically promote their least-competent employees to management, in order to limit the amount of damage they are capable of doing.
The Dunning–Kruger effect is a cognitive bias wherein unskilled individuals suffer from illusory superiority, mistakenly rating their ability much higher than is accurate.
“Eureka” is an interjection used to celebrate a discovery or invention.
Fair use is a limitation and exception to the exclusive right granted by copyright law to the author of a creative work.

Gestalt psychology tries to understand the laws of our ability to acquire and maintain meaningful perceptions in an apparently chaotic world. Its central principle is that the mind forms a global whole with self-organizing tendencies.
Phrase used by ancient Roman and Medieval cartographers when denoting unknown territories on maps.
The “infinite canvas” is a series of design strategies to lay out comics based on treating the screen as a window rather than a page.
The Book of Kells is an illuminated manuscript Gospel book in Latin, containing the four Gospels of the New Testament together with various prefatory texts and tables.
Murphy's law is typically stated as: Anything that can go wrong, will go wrong.

description: The Maya numeral system is a vigesimal (base-twenty) positional numeral system used by the Pre-Columbian Maya civilization.

definition: The nadir at a given point is the local vertical direction pointing in the direction of the force of gravity at that location.
Panspermia is the hypothesis that life is distributed throughout the Universe by meteoroids, asteroids, comets, planetoids and spacecrafts.

The Peter Principle is a concept in management theory in which the selection of a candidate for a position is based on the candidate's performance in their current role rather than on abilities relevant to the intended role. Thus, employees only stop being promoted once they can no longer perform effectively, and “managers rise to the level of their incompetence”.
Quan is a loosely defined quality combining or uniting athletic skill with love and respect, as well as money.

description: The Scoville scale is the measurement of the pungency (spicy heat) of chili peppers or other spicy foods.

definition: A watershed is a basin-like landform defined by highpoints and ridgelines that descend into lower elevations and stream valleys.
The Zeitgeist is the intellectual fashion or dominant school of thought that typifies and influences the culture of a particular period in time.
